plants.name: Rosa chinensis
plants.description: A hardy rose species known for its continuous blooming habit and fragrant flowers, often cultivated in gardens worldwide.
plants.bloomingSeason: Year-round in suitable climates, with peak bloom in late spring to early summer
plants.location: Widely cultivated; native to Southwest China; grows in temperate and subtropical regions globally
plants.funFact: China Roses introduced repeat blooming traits to European roses, revolutionizing rose breeding.

plants.name: Delphinium elatum
plants.description: A striking perennial with tall spikes of densely packed flowers, beloved in cottage gardens.
plants.location: Native to temperate Northern Hemisphere regions; commonly grown in Europe and North America
plants.funFact: Delphiniums contain alkaloids that can be toxic, so gardeners should handle with care.

plants.name: Grevillea robusta
plants.description: A fast-growing Australian native tree with clusters of bright orange flowers attractive to birds.
plants.bloomingSeason: Late spring to early summer in the Southern Hemisphere (Novemberâ€“January) but blooms variably depending on local conditions; in equatorial climates, can bloom around June
plants.location: Native to eastern Australia; grown as ornamental and street trees worldwide in subtropical zones
plants.funFact: Despite its common name, Silky Oak is actually a member of the Proteaceae family, not an oak.

plants.name: Lupinus perennis
plants.description: A wildflower commonly found in pine barrens and sandy soils with tall spikes of pea-like flowers.
plants.funFact: Wild Lupine is crucial for the endangered Karner Blue butterfly, which depends on it as a larval food plant.
